ResourceHeader.ResourceName: All-sky auroral image taken by the white-light all-sky camera at Syowa Station, Antarctica.
ResourceHeader.Description: Auroral all-sky images taken by the white-light all-sky CCD camera (body: WATEC WAT-120N+, lens: FUJINON YV2.2Ã—1.4A-SA2) at Syowa Station, Antarctica. All images are recorded in the JPEG format with a temporal resolution of ~1s. Three types of summary plot are available from the project web site: 1-min all-sky images in PDF, 1-night keogram in PNG, and 1-night movie in mpeg. If you need the original 1-sec resolution data for the purpose of scientific researches, please contact Dr. Akira Kadokura (kadokura [at] nipr.ac.jp).
ResourceHeader.Acknowledgement: Please contact Dr. Akira Kadokura (kadokura [at] nipr.ac.jp), National Institute of Polar Research (NIPR) before using the data at any publications and/or presentations. We welcome collaborative research and strongly recommend users to contact us early in order to ensure that the data are suitable for their research. When the data are used at any publications and/or presentations, we would like to ask the users to acknowledge NIPR and send us one copy of the reprints. An example of the acknowledgement statement is as follows: "Aurora images were provided by National Institute of Polar Research, Japan."
